description: Located on a corner plot along Bethnal Green Road in a rapidly evolving area of East London, this former 1970s textile workshop has been transformed into a low-energy, materially rich creative workspace

factsheet.heading: The tour
paragraphs: Join the design team for an architectural tour of 469 Bethnal Green Road, a newly redeveloped creative workspace in the heart of East London.

The tour will start outside the building, where the team will introduce the redevelopment within the context of the local area. From there, the tour will move inside to explore the reuse of the existing building and materiality of the new galvanised steel extension.

factsheet.heading: The building
paragraphs: The design draws on the building’s spatial and material qualities, retaining the masonry-clad steel frame and doubling its form with a new lightweight three-story extension. The new facades are made with hot-dipped galvanised steel plates, designed to be harmonious with the existing silver-grey brick base.

Architectural elements such as eaves, window sills, and reveals are deliberately emphasised to balance the building’s mass and provide passive solar shading for the large ribbon windows. The project’s focus on reusing the existing structure has significantly reduced carbon emissions during construction, while passive design details will contribute to lower energy consumption during operation, making this project an exemplar of environmental sustainability.
